channel.title: Unipban problems 317 PI
channel.description: Hi im having some troubles with my ipsbanned log. When i try and unipban someone by deleting there ip from that log it doesnt work and i dont have a unipban command to use. can someone make a unipban command for me so that i can use that cause my log does not work.

item.title: Unipban problems 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @RobinZ7 RobinZ7
item.description:
@RobinZ7 wrote:

hey i am really dumb and stupid in rsps (i agree)
i made a acc from my comp and logged into the owner acc and i was just thinking does the ipban work so i ipbanned myself (i mean i ipbanned the acc i made from the owner acc) i know iam so dumb but can u plz help me?
i though that i hav the source and client folder so there is hope
(hopefully)

plz help
help will be really helpful

plz help

i just wanna know how to unipban myself

Read full topic

item.title: Unipban problems 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

just made this real quick.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("unipmute")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Connection.unIPBanUser(Server.playerHandler.players[i].connectedFrom); c.sendMessage("You have Un Ip-Banned the user: "+Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

in connection.java \src\server
under this

public static void unIPMuteUser(String name) { mutedIps.remove(name); deleteFromFile("./Data/bans/IpsMuted.txt", name); }

add this

public static void unIPBanUser(String name) { mutedIps.remove(name); deleteFromFile("./Data/bans/IpsBanned.txt", name); }

Haven’t tested it, but got no compiling errors. Pretty simple to do.

Read full topic

lol thx i needed this command also and it worked for me thx man its also a 317 delta source

No wonder why… Figured it was… I hate people that don’t read the top. I asked for a PI command not a delta.

item.title: Unipban problems 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @DannyBoy1995 DannyBoy1995
item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

[quote=“metal k0, post:2, topic:404409”]Try this;

if (command.startsWith("unipban") && playerRights >= 3) { yell("["+playerName+"] Has Just UnIP Banned A Player!"); try { String victim = command.substring(9); BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config//ipbans.txt")); BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config//ipbans.txt")); String unmute = command.substring(6); String inFile; if (victim != null) { int ID = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim); client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) { if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unmute)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file. } else { out.write(inFile); } } p.disconnected = true; } } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } } [/quote]
I get these:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:526: cannot find symbol symbol : variable command location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands if (command.startsWith("unipban") && playerRights >= 3 { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:526: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerRights location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands if (command.startsWith("unipban") && playerRights >= 3 { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:527: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerName location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands yell("["+playerName+"] Has Just UnIP Banned A Player!"); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:527: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands yell("["+playerName+"] Has Just UnIP Banned A Player!"); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:529: cannot find symbol symbol : variable command location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands String victim = command.substring(9); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:532: cannot find symbol symbol : variable command location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands String unmute = command.substring(6); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:536: cannot find symbol symbol : method getPlayerID(java.lang.String) location: class server.model.players.PlayerHandler int ID = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:537: cannot find symbol symbol : class client location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:537: cannot find symbol symbol : class client location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:537: cannot find symbol symbol : class playerHandler location: package server client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 10 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Unipban problems 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @metal_k0 metal k0
item.description:
@metal_k0 wrote:

Try this;

if (command.startsWith("unipban") && playerRights >= 3) { yell("["+playerName+"] Has Just UnIP Banned A Player!"); try { String victim = command.substring(9); BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config//ipbans.txt")); BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config//ipbans.txt")); String unmute = command.substring(6); String inFile; if (victim != null) { int ID = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim); client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) { if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unmute)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file. } else { out.write(inFile); } } p.disconnected = true; } } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic
